title: Chocolate chia pudding Chocolate chia pudding
steps: Mix all the ingredients in a big bowl
Add a pinch of salt
Whisk to combine the ingredients
Cover with a plastic film and leave for 4 hrs in the fridge
Pour the mix in small glasses
Add forze berries and cacao powder
enjoy

title: Vegan brownies
ingredients: 80g vegan margarine, plus extra for greasing
steps: Heat oven to 170C/150C and grease and line a 20cm square tin with baking parchment.
Combine the flaxseed with 6 tbsp water and set aside for at least 5 mins
melt 120g chocolate, the coffee and margarine with 60ml water on a low heat. Allow to cool slightly.
Put the flour, almonds, cocoa, baking powder and ¼ tsp salt in a bowl and stir to remove any lumps.
Using a hand whisk, mix the sugar into the melted chocolate mixture, and beat well until smooth and glossy
Stir in the flaxseed mixture, vanilla extract and remaining chocolate, then the flour mixture.
Bake for 35-45 mins until a skewer inserted in the middle comes out clean with moist crumbs.
Allow to cool in the tin completely, then cut into squares.
instructions: Eat the brownies within three days.

title: Buffalo Cauliflower Bites
ingredients: ⅓ cup Frank’s hot sauce or barbecue sauce
steps: Preheat oven to 232°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Combine the tomato paste, garlic powder, onion powder, brown rice flour, almond flour, paprika, parsley, and ⅔ cup of water in a blender. Mix until the batter is smooth and thick.
Add the batter to a bowl and add the cauliflower
Mix until the cauliflowers are well covered with the batter
Lay the cauliflower in a single layer on the baking sheets, making sure that the florets do not touch each other.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until crisp on the edges.
Transfer to a bowl and drizzle with the sauce.
Enjoy
instructions: Eat the brownies within three days.

title: Vegan Corn Cream
steps: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Stir in onions and celery and cook until the onions are golden
Stir in carrots and garlic until garlic is a bit golden.
At the same time, bring water to a boil over high heat and ad the cubes of boullion
When bouillon cubes have dissolved, add corn and the vegetables from the pan.
Cook until vegetables are tender. If required add water.
Reduce heat to low, and pour in 1 cup soy milk.
Stir soup well and add the second cup of soy milk.
Quickly whisk in flour. Stir in parsley, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Keep stirring constantly, until chowder thickens, it takes aroun 15 to 20 minutes.
Enjoy

title: Thai Sweet Potato Noodle Bowl
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, spiralized into thick noodles
1 cup thinly sliced red bell pepper
steps: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium-high
Add sweet potato noodles, bell pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon salt; sauté 5 minutes.
Add 1/4 cup water; cover and cook 3 minutes.
Add tofu and spinach; sauté 4 minutes.
Combine remaining 1/4 cup water, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, coconut milk, almond butter, and curry paste in a bowl.
Serve with lime wedges
Enjoy

title: Carrot Ginger Salad
steps: Peel and cut the carrots in the shape of stick
Fry the sesame seeds for 2-3 minutes until lightly toasted, then set aside
Mix the lemon juice, peanut oil, sesame oil, ginger in a cup; then add salt and pepper
Combine the toasted sesame seeds, carrot and bean sprouts in a medium bowl. Pour the dressing
Enjoy

title: Blueberry Smoothie
ingredients: 1 ½ cups to 2 cups unsweetened almond milk
steps: Combine all of the ingredients
Stop to scrape down the sides
add more milk if necessary.
Enjoy
